My understanding is that in 2.0.1, overrides of rules can only (1) 
change 'parent' sheet values (including the 'enabled' toggle); (2) add 
new rules *at the end*.  So inserting override rules at other places in 
the rule-ordering is not possible.

I was in a simple test able to add a reject-all scope rule in an 
override sheet. It appeared at the end of all rules and had the expected 
rejection effect on URIs to which it was mapped, but not other URIs.

(Attempting to reorder the new rule up into the inherited rules 
generated an ugly exception. Both docs and the UI should be more clear 
that such mixing isn't supported.)

The UI for configuration is changing yet again in the 2.2 work, but we 
hope that adopting the Spring model will make the underlying storage 
format and relationships between configured components (ie now beans) 
more understandable.

It would be appropriate to file bugs for any or all of the following:

- your override sheet rules don't take effect at all, even at the end

- the UI or docs don't explain what's allowable, or mislead about what 
is allowed (like suggesting you might be able to mis the ordering of 
global and override rules)

- you get unhelpful error stacks from the UI or in logs when attempting 
certain operations

- Gordon @ IA
